meanings.definition: Lasting for an indefinitely long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The eonian mountains stood tall and majestic, unchanged for centuries.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins bore witness to the eonian passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The eonian tortoise challenged the hare to a race, knowing it would last forever.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was eonian, like a timeless melody playing in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The eonian stars sparkled in the night sky, a reminder of eternity.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of an eon.
meanings.sent1: The eonian history of the planet fascinated the young students.
meanings.sent2: The eonian cycle of life and death continued without interruption.
meanings.sent3: The eonian fashion trend of bell-bottoms made a surprising comeback.
meanings.sent4: His eonian wisdom was sought by all who sought guidance.
meanings.sent5: The eonian silence of the library was broken only by the turning of pages.

meanings.definition: Existing or continuing for an immeasurably long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The eonian debate between the two scholars seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent2: The eonian oak tree had witnessed generations come and go.
meanings.sent3: The eonian traffic jam made commuters question the concept of time.
meanings.sent4: Her eonian patience finally paid off when she found the lost ring.
meanings.sent5: The eonian rain poured down relentlessly, flooding the streets.
